member.summary: Can assemble the document (create bookmarks, thumbnail images or insert, rotate, delete pages). This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used.

member.summary: Can copy the document content.

member.summary: Can edit PDF document annotations.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanEditContent
member.summary: Can edit PDF document content.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanFillFormFields
member.summary: Can fill the form fields. This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. To disable form filling the CanEditContent and CanEditAnnotations must be set on false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanPrint
member.summary: Can print the document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.KeySize
member.summary: The dimension of the encryption key. By default a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.OwnerPassword
member.summary: The password required to change permissions of the PDF document like printing or editing. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.UserPassword
member.summary: The password required to open the PDF document. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.String,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfFont)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified font. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined. The width is the available width in page.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.String,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfFont,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfColor)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified font and colot. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined. The width is the available width in page.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.
The text color

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfFont)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified width and font. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfFont)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered in the specified rectangle using the specified width, height and font.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being given by the minimum between the specified height and the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the specified height is bigger than the available space on page), the height parameter will be ignored and the text will be rendered to the end using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed but the text does not need pagination (the specified height is less than the available space on page), the rendered text will be truncated to fit the specified height. The text bounds inside the current page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle
The height of the destination rectangle
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfFont,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfColor)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified width, font and color. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfFont,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfColor)
member.summary:
Contructs a paginable text element that will be rendered in the specified rectangle using the specified width, height, font and color.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the embedFont parameter of Document.Fonts.Add(System.Drawing.Font font, bool embedFont) is true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( Paginate property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being given by the minimum between the specified height and the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( Paginate property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the specified height is bigger than the available space on page), the height parameter will be ignored and the text will be rendered to the end using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed but the text does not need pagination (the specified height is less than the available space on page), the rendered text will be truncated to fit the specified height. The text bounds inside the current page and the last page index are returned in the AddTextElementResult object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle
The height of the destination rectangle
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.
The text color

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TextElement.Render(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ElementsRenderer)
member.summary: Renders the text using the specified renderer. The renderer can be a page or a template.
member.param: The renderer to render this text element
member.returns: The

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance to move the text baseline up or down from its default location. Adjustments to the baseline are useful for drawing superscripts or subscripts. Positive values of text rise move the baseline up and creates a superscript text. Negative values of text rise move the baseline down and creates a subscript text.

member.summary: Gets or sets the web page height. If the width was not set aswell, this property has no effect

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key string received from the vendor. If this property is null the converter will automatically enter in evaluation mode and a demo watermark will be displayed on the generated image.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.BatchConversion
member.summary: This property is obsolete.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.ScriptsEnabled
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.ActiveXEnabled
member.summary: Enable ActiveX controls when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.BehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Enable behaviors when rendering HTML to image. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.AddPadding
member.summary: Add padding at the end of the conversion result. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.BinaryBehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Internal use. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.InternetSecurityZone
member.summary: Specifies the internet security zone settings used by the HTML converter to convert web sites.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.AuthenticationUsername
member.summary: Optionally set the Username property to authenticate to web server before accessing the URL to be converted (e.g handles any IIS authentication method)

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.AuthenticationPassword
member.summary: Optionally set the Password property to authenticate to web server before accessing the URL to be converted (e.g handles any IIS authentication method)

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be loaded. A delay is necessary for example to allow a Flash movie to start before starting conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the HTTP headers sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. The HTTP headers string can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.SerializeLoadHtml
member.summary: This static flag indicates if the download and execution of the HTML code is serialized when the converter is called simultaneously from multiple threads of an application. This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed in the current process.Default value is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.LoadHtmlConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: This static parameter gives the maximum number of threads in the current process that can download and execute HTML documents simultaneously. This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed in the current process. When this parameter is 0 or negative and SerializeLoadHtml is false the concurrency level is the maximum value.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImgConverter.SamplingEnabled
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea
member.summary: Objects of this class can be used to render a HTML string or an URL to a specified position in the header or footer of the document. The PdfConverter.PdfHeaderOptions.HtmlToPdfArea property can be set with an object of this type.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfElement
member.summary: The base class for the PDF elements that can be added to header and footer.

An optional parameter.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.DEFAULT_HTML_VIEWER_WIDTH_PX
member.summary: The default virtual browser width in pixels

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element and places the rendered PDF content inside a rectangle with the top left corner at (0,0) coordinate and having the width equal to PDF page width. The converter is using the default values for the HTML viewer width and height. The HTML string to convert is given by the htmlStringToConvert parameter.
member.param: The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. This parameter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.#ctor(System.String)

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element and places the rendered PDF content inside a rectangle with the top left corner at (x,y) coordinate and having the width equal to the width specified as parameter. The HTML string to convert is given by the htmlStringToConvert parameter. The converter is using the specified value for HTML viewer width and the default value for the HTML viewer height.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page
The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. This paramter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

The virtual browser width in pixels. The default value is 1024 pixels. The effect of this parameter is similar to viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width. When this parameter is less or equal 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page width from the body element width.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)

The HTML string to convert is given by the htmlStringToConvert parameter. The converter is using the values specified as parameters for HTML viewer width and height.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or auomatic page breaks.
The HTML string convert to PDF.

When this parameter is less or equal 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page width from the body element width.

The virtual browser height in pixels. The default value is 0 which means the height will be auto-determined. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window ` with the specified width and height. When this paramter is less or equal 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page height from the body element height.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer width in pixels

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the viewer width was not set, this property has no effect

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.AvoidTextBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the text between PDF pages

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When false the HTML content will be rendered at the real size. By default this property is true and the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect only when FitWidth property is true. When FitWidth is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.AdjustBorderSize
member.summary: A small value to subtract from the width and hight of the colored background to make the thin lines of 1 pixel around this background more visible when zooming out in the Adobe Reader PDF Viewer. The default value is 0.5 pixels.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.AdjustThinLinesWidth
member.summary: A small increment value for the 1 pixel thin lines width to make them more visible when zooming out in the Adobe Reader PDF Viewer. The default value is 0 pixels.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.DrawBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML page background is rendered in PDF. Default value is true. Setting this property to false can make visible the existing PDF content behind this element.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.DrawBackColors
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the background color of the HTML elements is rendered in PDF. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.BkgTransparency
member.summary: Modify background transparency. 0 means transparent, 100 means opaque.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.ImgTransparency
member.summary: Modify images transparency. 0 means transparent, 100 means opaque.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.AlphaBlendEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables alpha blending for transparent images. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.MaskBltEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables masking for transparent images. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.RightToLeftEnabled
member.summary: This property is obsolete. Setting this property is not necessary anymore when converting pages in right-to-left languages like Hebrew or Arabic.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.BatchConversion
member.summary: This property is obsolete.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.ScriptsEnabled

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.ScriptsEnabledInImage
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.ActiveXEnabled
member.summary: Enable ActiveX when rendering HTML to selectable PDF. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.ActiveXEnabledInImage
member.summary: Enable ActiveX when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.BehaviorsEnabled

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.InternetSecurityZone
member.summary: Specifies the internet security zone settings used by the HTML converter to convert web sites.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.EmbedFonts
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to embed all the true type fonts into the PDF document. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be loaded. A delay is necessary for example to allow a Flash movie to start before starting conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the HTTP headers sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. The HTTP headers string can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the html links in PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.TruncateOutOfBoundsText
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.OptimizePdfPageBreaks
member.summary: A flag indicating if the converter uses an optimized page breaks algorithm to improve document scrolling inside a PDF Viewer. The optimized algorithm can introduce a small additional processing time when the PDF document is generated. The default value is true and the optimized page breaks algorithm is used by default.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.OptimizeMemoryUsage
member.summary: When this property is true the library will try to release the unused memory as soon as possible. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the internal HTML links to internal PDF links when the HtmlToPdfArea is added to a PDF page. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Defines the necessary API to retrieve the positions in the generated PDF document for the HTML elements specified in a list. The HTML elements are specified by their unique HTML ID or HTML tag name.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.HtmlElementIds
member.summary: This property is used to set an array containing the HTML IDs of the HTML elements for which to retrieve position in PDF. The HTML ID of a HTML element is given by its ID or NAME property in the HTML document. The HTML IDs are case insensitive. If there are many HTML elements with the same HTML ID in the HTML document, only the first HTML element with that ID will be retrieved. The elements mapping will be retrieved in the HtmlElementsMappingResult property after conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.HtmlTagNames
member.summary: This property is used to set an array containing the HTML tag names of the HTML elements for which to retrieve position in PDF. The HTML tag names are case insensitive. The elements mapping will be retrieved in the HtmlElementsMappingResult property after conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlElementsMappingOptions.HtmlElementsMappingResult
member.summary: This property is set by the converter after conversion and returns the mapping of the HTML elements specified by the HtmlElementIds and HtmlTagNames lists.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.TextArea.TextRise
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance to move the text baseline up or down from its default location. Adjustments to the baseline are useful for drawing superscripts or subscripts. Positive values of text rise move the baseline up and creates a superscript text. Negative values of text rise move the baseline down and creates a subscript text.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfStandardSubset
member.summary: The PDF subset used by the document.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Full
member.summary: The full PDF features can be used in the generated PDF document.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Pdf_A_1b
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/A 1b standard which makes the document suitable for long term archiving. All the true type fonts are embedded in the PDF document, external HTTP links are disabled, transparencies are disabled, and some special metadata to identify the document as PDF/A compliant is inserted in the generated document.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Pdf_X_1a
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/X 1a standard which makes the document suitable for graphics exchange.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Pdf_SiqQ_a
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/SiqQ Level A standard which makes the document suitable for being digitally signed. In PDF/SiqQ Level A all the true type fonts are embedded in the PDF document and the external HTTP links are disabled.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Pdf_SiqQ_b
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/SiqQ Level B standard which makes the document suitable for being digitally signed. In PDF/SiqQ Level A all the true type fonts are embedded in the generated PDF document.

member.summary: The parent PDF Document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageCollection.#ctor(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document)

member.summary: Gets the collection enumerator.
member.returns: The collection enumerator.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageCollection.AddNewPage
member.summary: Creates a new PDF page and adds it to the collection. If there is a previous page in the collection, the orientation and size are inherited from the that page otherwise a first page with the default A4 size and Portrait orientation is created. The page margins are inherited from the default document margins.
member.returns: The newly created PDF page.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageCollection.AddNewPage(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Margins)
member.summary: Creates a new PDF page and adds it to the collection. If there is a previous page in the collection, the orientation and size are inherited from the that page otherwise a first page with the default A4 size and Portrait orientation is created.
member.param: The PDF page margins.
member.returns: The newly created PDF page.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageCollection.AddNewPage(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageSize,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Margins)
member.summary: Creates a new PDF page and adds it to the collection. If there is a previous page in the collection, the page orientation is inherited from the that page otherwise a first page with the specified size and Portrait orientation is created.
member.param: The page size in points.
The page mergins in points.
member.returns: The newly created PDF page.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageCollection.AddNewPage(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageSize,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Margins,ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PDFPageOrientation)

The PDF page orientation.

The PDF page size in points.

The PDF page orientation.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageCollection.Add(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage)
member.summary: Adds the specified page to the document pages collection. The page to be added is allowed to be from another document. The source document of the page to be added must remain opened until the current document is saved.
member.param: The page to be added to the collection.
member.returns: The index of the page in collection. If the page already exists, this method returns the index of the existing page

member.param: The index where the page will be inserted.
The PDF page to be inserted.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the appearance of the header in the rendered PDF document. The PDFConverter class contains a reference to an object of this type. If the ShowHeader property of the PDFDocumentOptions object is false, the header options have no efect

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.AddTextArea(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.TextArea)
member.summary: Adds a TextArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined header elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The TextArea object to be rendered.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.AddImageArea(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ImageArea)
member.summary: Adds an ImageArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined header elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The ImageArea object to be rendered.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.AddHtmlToPdfArea(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea)
member.summary: Adds a HtmlToPdfArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined header elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The HtmlToPdfArea object to be rendered.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HtmlToPdfArea
member.summary: Set this property with a HtmlToPdfArea object to render HTML code or URL in header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.TextArea
member.summary: Set this property with a TextArea object to render a text in header. If &p; tag is appears in the TextArea text, it will be replaced with the current PDF page number. By default the page numbering starts with 1. The start index of the page numbering can be changed using the PageNumberingStartIndex property. If &P; tag appears in the TextArea text, it will be replaced with the total number of pages in the PDF document. Optionally, a constat value given by the PageNumberingPageCountIncrement can be added to the total number of pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.ImageArea
member.summary: Set this property with an ImageArea object to render an image in header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderBackColor
member.summary: The background color of the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderLineColor
member.summary: The color of the optional line displayed in the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderImage
member.summary: The image to be displayed in the header. The image will be displayed at the location specified by the HeaderImageLocation and its width in PDF is specified by the HeaderImageWidth property. This property is obsolete and it was preserved for backward compatibility. The preferred property is ImageArea.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderImageLocation
member.summary: The location in points inside the header where to display the image. By default it is displayed in the top left corner of the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderImageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the header image width in PDF. The value is in points and the image will be resized if necessary to fit the specified width. When the width is negative, the image will be displayed at real size in PDF.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderHeight
member.summary: The height in points of PDF header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderText
member.summary: The text to appear in the rendered PDF document title.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTextYLocation
member.summary: The Y location of the header text in points.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTextAlign
member.summary: The header text alignment.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTextColor
member.summary: The color of the text displayed in the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTextFontType
member.summary: The standard PDF font type of the text displayed in the header. The standard PDF fonts don't support unicode texts. In order to use a Unicode text you have to set this propery to None and define the true type font using the HeaderTextFontName propery. Default this property is None and the HeaderTextFontName true type font is used.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTextFontName
member.summary: The font family name of the true type font used to display the header text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTextFontStyle
member.summary: The style of the true type font used to display the header text. This property has effect only when HeaderTextFontType is None.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTextFontSize
member.summary: The font size in points of the text displayed in the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderSubtitleText
member.summary: A PDF document header subtitle.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderSubtitleTextColor
member.summary: The color of the text displayed in the header subtitle

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderSubtitleTextFontType
member.summary: The standard PDF font type of the text displayed in the header subtitle. The standard PDF fonts don't support unicode texts. In order to use a Unicode text you have to set this propery to None and define the true type font using the HeaderSubtitleTextFontName propery. Default this property is None and the HeaderSubtitleTextFontName true type font is used.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderSubtitleTextFontName
member.summary: The font family name of the true type font used to display the header subtitle text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderSubtitleTextFontStyle
member.summary: The style of the true type font used to display the header subtitle text. This property has effect only when HeaderSubtitleTextFontType is None.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderSubtitleTextFontSize
member.summary: The font size in points of the text displayed in the header subtitle.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderTitleSubtitleYSpacing
member.summary: The Y distance in points between the title and the subtitle.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.DrawHeaderLine
member.summary: When true, a line is displayed under the header area. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.ShowOnOddPages
member.summary: Show or not the header on odd pages. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages. The ShowOnFirstPage property has priority over ShowOnOddPages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.ShowOnEvenPages
member.summary: Show or not the header on even pages. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.ShowOnFirstPage
member.summary: When this property is true the header will be shown on the first page otherwise it will not be shown. This property has priority over ShowOnOddPages. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.PageNumberingStartIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the start index for page numbering using the &p; variable in a TextArea element added to the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfHeaderOptions.PageNumberingPageCountIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets an increment for the total number of pages displayed using &P; variable in a TextArea element added to the header.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the PDF document redering process. The PdfConverter class define a reference to an object of this type.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.LeftMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document left margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.RightMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document right margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TopMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document top margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.BottomMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document bottom margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfCompressionLevel
member.summary: This property controls the compression level of the rendered PDF document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated PDF. By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated PDF. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated PDF is lower than the quality of the original images in the HTML document, function of the JpegCompressionLevel parameter. When the JpegCompressionLevel is increased, the quality of the images in PDF decreases.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level of images in the generated PDF as an integer value between 0 and 100. This property has effect only when the JpegCompressionEnabled is true. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst. The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in PDF.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfPageSize
member.summary: This property controls the size of the rendered PDF document pages. The default size of the PDF document is A4. When this property is set to PdfPageSize.Custom, a custom size in points for the generated PDF document can be specified using the CustomPdfPageSize property.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.CustomPdfPageSize
member.summary: This property gives the PDF page size when the PdfPageSize property is set Custom.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is true and the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When this property is false the HTML content is not resized (is rendered at the real size) and therefore it could be cut off at the right size if the PDF page is not enough wide to display the whole HTML content. In this case the AutoSizePdfPage property can be set on true to automatically resize the PDF page width to display the whole content.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect only when FitWidth property is true. When FitWidth is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.SinglePage
member.summary: When this property is true the converter will generate a single PDF page with a custom size calculated to display the whole HTML content and any specified header and footer. If the FitWidth property is true the specified PDF page width will be preserved, otherwise the PDF page width is automatically calculated by the converter to display the whole HTML content at real size.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AutoSizePdfPage
member.summary: When the property AutoSizePdfPage property is true the converter will automatically calculate the PDF page size such that all the HTML content will be visible in the resulted PDF document. This property has effect only when the FitWidth and FitHeight properties are false. When the FitWidth property is false (the HTML content is rendered at real size) and the AutoSizePdfPage is false the rendered HTML content could be cut off at the right of the generated PDF document if the PDF page is not wide enough to display the whole content.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfPageOrientation
member.summary: This property controls the page orientation of the rendered PDF document pages. The default orientation is Portrait.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf
member.summary: When this property is true the generated PDF will contain selectable text. When this property is false, the converter will embed a snapshot image of the HTML document in PDF. The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ShowHeader
member.summary: This property controls the whether the header appears or not in the rendered PDF document. The header properties can be further customized by setting the properties of the PDFHeaderOptions object exposed by the PDFHeaderOptions property of the PdfConverter class. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.EmbedFonts
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to embed all the true type fonts into the PDF document. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the external links from HTML to PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the internal HTML links (links with anchors) to internal PDF links. This feature can be used for example to create table of contents in the generated PDF. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ShowFooter
member.summary: This property controls the whether the footer appears or not in the rendered PDF document. The footer properties can be further customized by setting the properties of the PDFFooterOptions object exposed by the PDFFooterOptions property of the PDFConverter class. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AppendPDFFile
member.summary: The full path of an existing PDF document to be appended to the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the appended document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AppendPDFFileArray
member.summary: An array of full paths of existing PDF documents to be appended to the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the appended documents.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AppendPDFStream
member.summary: A PDF stream to be appended to the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the appended document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AppendPDFStreamArray
member.summary: An array of PDF streams to be appended to the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the appended documents.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PrependPDFFile
member.summary: The full path of an existing PDF document which will prefix the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. This property can be used to add a cover pages to the document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the prepended document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PrependPDFFileArray
member.summary: An array of full paths of existing PDF documents which will prefix the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. This property can be used to add a cover page or document to the document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the prepended documents.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PrependPDFStream
member.summary: The PDF stream which will prefix the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. This property can be used to add a cover pages to the document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the prepended document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PrependPDFStreamArray
member.summary: An array of PDF streams which will prefix the PDF document resulted after HTML conversion. This property can be used to add cover pages to the document resulted after HTML conversion. Headers and footers are not applied on the prepended documents.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences
member.summary: Represents the viewer preferences of the PDF document

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.HideToolbar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s tool bars when the document is active. Default value: False.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.HideMenuBar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s menu bar when the document is active. Default value: False.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed. Default value: False.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: False.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to position the document’s window in the center of the screen. Default value: False.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the title entry of the document information dictionary. Default value: False.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: The document’s page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode. This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.Direction
member.summary: The predominant reading order for text. Default value: L2R.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.PageMode
member.summary: Specifies how the document should be displayed when opened. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.ViewerPreferences.PageLayout
member.summary: The page layout to be used when the document is opened. Default value: OneColumn.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PolygonElement
member.summary: Represents a polygon

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PolygonElement.#ctor(System.Drawing.PointF[])
member.summary: Constructs a polygon element
member.param: The points to be connected

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateAnchoring
member.summary: The anchoring position of the PDF template.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateAnchoring.NotAnchored
member.summary: The template is not anchored.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateAnchoring.Center
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the center of the PDF page. The center of the template rectangle will be same with the center of the page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateAnchoring.TopLeft
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the top left corner of the page. The template location will be the top left corner of the page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateAnchoring.TopRight
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the top right corner of the page. The right side of the template will be aligned with the right side of the page, and the top side of the template will be aligned with the top side of the page

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateAnchoring.BottomLeft
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the bottom left corner of the page. The left side of the template will be aligned with the left side of the page and the bottom side of the document will be aligned with the bottom side of the page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateAnchoring.BottomRight
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the bottom left corner of the page. The right side of the document will be aligned with the right side of the PDF page and the bottom side of the document will be aligned with the bottom side of the PDF page

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateDocking
member.summary: The docking style of the PDF template.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateDocking.NotDocked
member.summary: The template is not docked in PDF page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateDocking.Top
member.summary: The template is docked to the the top of the PDF page. The template width and location will be adjusted for docking.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateDocking.Bottom
member.summary: The template is docked to the bottom of the PDF page. The template width and location will be adjusted for docking.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateDocking.Left
member.summary: The template is docked to the left of the PDF page. The template location and height will be adjusted for docking.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateDocking.Right
member.summary: The template is docked to the right of the PDF page. The template location and height will be adjusted for docking.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.TemplateDocking.Fill
member.summary: The template fills the PDF page. The template location will be the top left corner and the size will be the size of the PDF page. The docking will take into account the existing document Header, Footer, Left and Right templates.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement
member.summary: This class encapsulates a HTML to Image converter. The HTML to Image conversion is performed when the element is added to a PDF page. The resulted image is embedded in the PDF document.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.DEFAULT_HTML_VIEWER_WIDTH_PX
member.summary: The default virtual browser width in pixels

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.AUTO_HTML_VIEWER_HEIGHT_PX
member.summary: The default virtual browser height in pixels is set to autodetect the HTML content height.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.AVAILABLE_PDF_WIDTH_POINTS
member.summary: The default width in PDF of the element is set to available width in PDF page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.AUTO_PDF_HEIGHT_POINTS
member.summary: The default width in PDF of the element is set to available width in PDF page.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to image converter element that will be rendered at the (0,0) location in PDF page. The width of element in PDF page is the available width in PDF page and the height is auto determined.
member.param: The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. This parameter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a URL to image converter element at the (0,0) location in PDF page. The width of element in PDF page is the available width in PDF page and the height is auto determined.
member.param: The URL to convert to PDF

The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed the destination width will be given by the available width in page

This parameter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to image converter element at the specified x and y coordinates with the specified width and height.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or auomatic page breaks.
The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. This parameter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a URL to image converter element at the specified x and y coordinates with the specified width and height.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or auomatic page breaks.
The URL to convert to PDF

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a HTML string to image converter element at the specified x and y coordinates with the specified width. The height in PDF is auto determined. The virtual browser width in pixels is specified by the htmlViewerWidth parameter.

The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. This parameter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer width in pixels

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the viewer width was not set, this property has no effect

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the resulted image will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When false the image will be rendered at the real size. By default this property is true and the image will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the resulted image will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect only when FitWidth property is true. When FitWidth is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the HTML links in PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the internal HTML links to internal PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.BatchConversion
member.summary: This property is obsolete.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.ScriptsEnabled
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.ActiveXEnabled
member.summary: Enable ActiveX controls when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.BehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Enable behaviors when rendering HTML to image. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.AddPadding
member.summary: Add padding at the end of the conversion result. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.BinaryBehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Internal use. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.InternetSecurityZone
member.summary: Specifies the internet security zone settings used by the HTML converter to convert web sites.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.Paginate
member.summary: When true the element can be paginated

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be loaded. A delay is necessary for example to allow a Flash movie to start before starting conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the HTTP headers sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. The HTTP headers string can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.ShowHeaderOnOddPages
member.summary: Show or not the document header on odd pages generated by this element. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages. The ShowHeaderTemplate property of the page to which this element is added has priority over ShowHeaderOnOddPages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.ShowHeaderOnEvenPages
member.summary: Show or not the document header on even pages generated by this element. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.ShowFooterOnOddPages
member.summary: Show or not the document footer on odd pages generated by this element. By default the footer is displayed both on odd and even pages. The ShowFooterTemplate property of the page to which this element is added has priority over ShowFooterOnOddPages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.ShowFooterOnEvenPages
member.summary: Show or not the document footer on even pages generated by this element. By default the footer is displayed both on odd and even pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation for the rendered PDF document. In order to enable creation of bookmarks you have to set the TagNames property of PdfBookmarkOptions with the names of the HTML tags you want to bookmark.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the retrieval of HTML elements position in the generated PDF. In order to retrieve the position in PDF for a list of HTML elements, the HtmlElementIds property of HtmlElementsMappingOptions must be set with an array of strings containing the HTML IDs of the HTML elements. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the HtmlElementsMappingResult object after the element was added to the page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.RenderedPagesRectangles
member.summary: The bounds of the rendered rectangle on each PDF page. This property is assigned after the element has been added to a PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.HtmlDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords, and description of the converted HTML document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToImageElement.SamplingEnabled

member.summary: Default line join style.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.LineJoinStyle.MitterJoin
member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameter— see "Miter Limit"), a bevel join is used instead.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.LineJoinStyle.RoundJoin
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pie slice-shaped figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.LineJoinStyle.BevelJoin
member.summary: The two segments are finished with caps (see "Line Cap Style") and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.summary: Default line cap style.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.LineCapStyle.ButtCap
member.summary: The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.LineCapStyle.RoundCap
member.summary: A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.LineCapStyle.ProjectingSquareCap
member.summary: The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is then squared off.

member.summary: Gets or sets the names of the HTML tags to be bookmarked, e.g. "H1". If null or empty no bookmark will be generated for the PDF document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.ClassNameFilter
member.summary: An additional filter to be applied to the tag name filter. This must be identical with the string set for the 'class' atttribute of the HTML tag.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.AllowDefaultTitle
member.summary: By default the converter will not generate bookmarks for the tags that don't have a text (e.g IMG tag). Setting this property true will instruct the converter to use the DefaultTitle or the tag outer HTML as bookmark title. The default value is false and therefore the converter will ignore the bookmarks for which a title cannot be automatically determined.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.DefaultTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the default title to be used for bookmarks that don't have an associated text. This property has effect only if AllowDefaultTitle is true and DefaultTitleToOuterHtml is false. This property defaults to "Bookmark" text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.DefaultTitleToOuterHtml
member.summary: When is true this property instructs the converter to use the tag outer HTML code as title when a correct title cannot be automatically determined for the bookmark. This property has effect only when the AllowDefaultTitle property is true and it has priority over the DefaultTitle property. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.BookmarkHiddenElements
member.summary: When this property is true the converter will generate bookmarks for hidden HTML elements. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfBookmarkOptions.MaxTitleLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum accepted length of the bookmark title string. If a positive value is set for this property the bookmark title will be truncated if necessasry. The default value is -1 and the bookmark title will not be truncated.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.Close
member.summary: Releases all the resources allocated by this PDF document. Always call this method after the document was saved. If the document was created from a stream or file, the stream will be closed if it was not explicitly detached by calling the DetachStream() before the document is closed.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.DetachStream
member.summary: Call this method to detach the stream from which this document was created. When this method is called before calling Close(), the Close method will not close the detached stream.
