member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.AutoCloseAppendedDocs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the PDF documents appended to this document using the AppendDocument() method are automatically closed when the current document is closed using the Close() method. The default value is false. The appended documents must remain open until the current document is saved.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Represents the default PDF document header template. This header is automatically considered when calculating the available space for drawing in a PDF page. This template is automatically docked to the top of the PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Represents the default PDF document footer template. This footer is automatically considered when calculating the available space for rendering in a PDF page. This template is automatically docked to the bottom of the PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.DocumentInformation
member.summary: Offers access to the document information object where the document's title, subject, keywords, etc can be set.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.ViewerPreferences
member.summary: Offers access to the viewer preferences settings for the document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.OpenAction
member.summary: The Go To or JavaScript action to be performed when the PDF document is opened.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.TransparencyEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the transparency is enabled in the generated PDF document. Default value is true. This property can be set to false to eliminate the additional flattening time when the document is sent to the printer from Adobe Reader viewer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.Bookmarks
member.summary: Gets the bookmarks collection of the document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the PDF document compression level

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated PDF. By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated PDF. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated PDF is lower than the quality of the original images in the HTML document, function of the JpegCompressionLevel parameter. When the JpegCompressionLevel is increased, the quality of the images in PDF decreases.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Document.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets the compression level of images in the generated PDF as an integer value between 0 and 100. This property has effect only when the JpegCompressionEnabled is true. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the JpegCompressionLevel is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst. The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in PDF.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DigitalCertificatesStore
member.summary: Provides and interface for getting digital certificates from system certificates store or from a password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public keys and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the Personal Certificates store. The Personal Certificates store can be accessed from Control Panel/Internet Options, Content, Certificates.
member.returns: The Personal certificates collection.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.CertSystemStore)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified system certificates store.
member.param: The system certificates store
member.returns: The certificates collection

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified PKCS#12 file. This method uses a NULL password to get the certificates from packet. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.
member.returns: The certificates collection.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.

The password used to decrypt and verify the PFX packet. This password must be exactly the same as the password that was used to encrypt the packet. If the password used to encrypt the packet was blank, pass NULL for the value of this parameter.
member.returns: The certificates collection.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending
member.summary: The blending function for transparent rendering mode.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.Blending.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.summary: Adds a TextArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined footer elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.AddHtmlToPdfArea(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlToPdfArea)
member.summary: Adds a HtmlToPdfArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined footer elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.HtmlToPdfArea
member.summary: Set this property with a HtmlToPdfElement object to render HTML code or URL in footer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.TextArea
member.summary: Set this property with a TextArea object to render a text in header. If &p; tag is appears in the TextArea text, it will be replaced with the current PDF page number. By default the page numbering starts with 1. The start index of the page numbering can be changed using the PageNumberingStartIndex property. If &P; tag appears in the TextArea text, it will be replaced with the total number of pages in the PDF document. Optionally, a constat value given by the PageNumberingPageCountIncrement can be added to the total number of pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.ImageArea
member.summary: Set this property with an ImageArea object to render an image in header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterBackColor
member.summary: The background color of the footer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterLineColor
member.summary: The color of the optional line displayed in the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterImage
member.summary: The image to be displayed in the footer. The image will be displayed at the location specified by the FooterImageLocation and its width in PDF is specified by the FooterImageWidth property. This property is obsolete and it was preserved for backward compatibility. The preferred property is ImageArea.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterImageLocation
member.summary: The location in points inside the footer where to display the image. By default it is displayed in the top left corner of the header.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterImageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the footer image width in PDF. The value is in points and the image will be resized if necessary to fit the specified width. When the width is negative, the image will be displayed at real size in PDF.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterHeight
member.summary: The height in points of PDF footer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterText
member.summary: The text to appear in the rendered PDF document footer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterTextYLocation
member.summary: The Y location in points of the footer text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterTextWidth
member.summary: The footer text width in points. Default is -1 which means the width of the text is the footer width.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterTextColor
member.summary: The color of the text displayed in the footer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterTextFontType
member.summary: The standard PDF font type of the text displayed in the footer. The standard PDF fonts don't support unicode texts. In order to use a Unicode text you have to set this propery to None and define the true type font using the FooterTextFontName propery. Default this property is None and the FooterTextFontName true type font is used.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterTextFontName
member.summary: The font family name of the true type font used to display the footer text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterTextFontStyle
member.summary: The style of the true type font used to display the footer text. This property has effect only when FooterTextFontType is None.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.FooterTextFontSize
member.summary: The font size in points of the text displayed in the footer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.ShowPageNumber
member.summary: When true, the default page numbering element is displayed in the footer. The default value is false and the default page numbering element is not displayed. The text displayed by the default page numbering element can be customized using the PageNumberingFormatString property. The page numbering formatting string can display the current page number using the &p; tag and the total number of pages using the &P; tag. An example of formatting string is "Page &p; of &P; pages".

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.DrawFooterLine
member.summary: When true, a line is displayed above the footer area. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberText
member.summary: The text to be displayed before the page number. The default value is 'Page'.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberingFormatString
member.summary: The custom format string used by the predefined page numbering element. By default this property is null and the default formatting string is used for the predefined page numbering element. The page numbering formatting string can display the current page number using the &p; tag and the total number of pages using the &P; tag. An example of formatting string is "Page &p; of &P; pages". The same formatting tags can be used in a TextArea element added to the footer. When this property is set with a value, the PageNumberText property used to customize the default formatting string is not used anymore. The predefined page numbering element is displayed in the footer only when ShowPageNumber is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberTextFontType
member.summary: The standard PDF font type of the text displayed in the footer page number text. The standard PDF fonts don't support unicode texts. In order to use a Unicode text you have to set this propery to None and define the true type font using the PageNumberTextFontName propery. Default this property is None and the PageNumberTextFontName true type font is used.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberTextFontName
member.summary: The font family name of the true type font used to display the footer page numbering text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberTextFontStyle
member.summary: The style of the true type font used to display the page numbering text in footer. This property has effect only when PageNumberTextFontType is None.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberTextFontSize
member.summary: The font size in points of the text displayed in the footer page numbering text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberTextColor
member.summary: The color of the text displayed in the footer page number text

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberYLocation
member.summary: The Y location in points of the page numbering text.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberingStartIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the start index for page numbering using the &p; variable in a TextArea element added to the footer or in the predefined numbering element.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.PageNumberingPageCountIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets an increment for the total number of pages displayed using &P; variable in a TextArea element added to the header or in the predefined numbering element.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.ShowOnOddPages
member.summary: Show or not the header on odd pages. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages. The ShowOnFirstPage property has priority over ShowOnOddPages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.ShowOnEvenPages
member.summary: Show or not the header on even pages. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfFooterOptions.ShowOnFirstPage
member.summary: When this property is true the footer will be shown on the first page otherwise it will not be shown. This property has priority over ShowOnOddPages. The default value is true.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter
member.summary: This class is the main class of the HTML to PDF Converter which offers the necessary methods to create a PDF document from a web page or from a HTML string. The generated PDF document can be saved in memory or in a file.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF converter which will use the default width of 1024 pixels to layout the HTML document. The height of the HTML document will be automatically calculated based on the default width. Because the default width of 1024 pixels might not be enough to display entirely the HTML document or because the HTML content might be scaled down to fit the PDF document page width, the other constructors allow to specify a custom width in pixels for the HTML document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF converter which will automatically calculate the height of the HTML document based on the specified width. The width in pixels of the HTML document is specified by the htmlDocWidthPx parameter. If this parameter is set to 0 or a negative value, the width of the HTML document will be automatically calculated. Because all the dimensions in the PDF document are measured in points (1 point is 1/72 inch), it might be necessary pixels to transform pixels to points and points to pixels using the UnitsConverter class in order to better control the HTML to PDF conversion.
member.param: The HTML document width in pixels.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML to PDF converter using the specified width and height in pixels for the HTML document. The width in pixels of the HTML document is specified by the htmlDocWidthPx parameter. If this parameter is set to 0 or a to negative value, the width of the HTML document will be automatically calculated. The height in pixels of the HTML document is specified by the htmlDocHeightPx parameter. The HTML document will be truncated if its height exceeds the htmlDocHeightPx value. If this parameter is set to 0 or a negative value, the whole HTML document will be converted to PDF. Because all the dimensions in the PDF document are measured in points (1 point is 1/72 inch), it might be necessary to transform pixels to points and points to pixels using the UnitsConverter class in order to better control the HTML to PDF conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPageCount(System.String)
member.summary: A fast method to obtain the page count of a specified PDF document.
member.param: The path of the PDF file for which to get the page count.
member.returns: The number of pages in the specified PDF document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPageCount(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: A fast method to obtain the page count of a specified PDF document.
member.param: The stream containing the PDF document for which to get the page count.
member.returns: The number of pages in the specified PDF document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified URL to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a HTML file from the local file system.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromUrl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified URL to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a HTML file from the local file system.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML document.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML file to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML file to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The full path of the HTML file to be converted to PDF.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML string.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the internal links might not be correctly converted. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. Because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the urlBase will be used by default. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.

The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. When a relative URL from the HTML string is prefixed by the urlBase, the correct full URL of the image or of the CSS file should be produced. When the urlBase is not null, the converter automatically inserts a <BASE HREF="urlBase"> tag under the HEAD tag from the HTML string. If the HTML string does not contain a HEAD tag, the urlBase parameter does not have any effect.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string.
The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML string.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlStream(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the HTML string read from the specified HTML stream to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the links with anchors, all the links with anchors are considered to be internal links. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlStream method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML stream containing the HTML string to be converted to PDF.
The encoding of the string read from the HTML stream.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlStringWithTempFile(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. The HTML string is first saved into a temporary HTML file. The temporary HTML file is then converted PDF. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the links with anchors, all the links with anchors are considered to be internal links. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlStringWithTempFile method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the specified HTML string to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. The HTML string is first saved into a temporary HTML file. The temporary HTML file is then converted PDF. The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. Because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the urlBase will be used by default. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlStringWithTempFile method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfDocumentObjectFromHtmlStreamWithTempFile(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Gets a Document object representing the result of conversion of the HTML string read from the specified HTML stream to PDF. The resulted Document object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion. The HTML string is first saved into a temporary HTML file. The temporary HTML file is then converted PDF. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the links with anchors, all the links with anchors are considered to be internal links. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlStreamWithTempFile method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.

member.returns: The Document object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The Document object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfFromUrlBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified URL into a PDF document and returns the rendered PDF document as an array of bytes. This method can be used to perform HTML to PDF conversion in internal memory. This method is obsolete and it was preserved for backward compatibility. It offers the same functionality as the GetPdfBytesFromUrl method which is the preferred method now.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a file from local file system.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string to PDF and returns the rendered PDF document as an array of bytes. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the internal links might not be correctly converted. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string to PDF and returns the rendered PDF document as an array of bytes. The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. Because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the urlBase will be used by default. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the GetPdfBytesFromHtmlString method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.

The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. When a relative URL from the HTML string is prefixed by the urlBase, the correct full URL of the image or of the CSS file should be produced. When the urlBase is not null, the converter automatically inserts a <BASE HREF="urlBase"> tag under the HEAD tag from the HTML string. If the HTML string does not contain a HEAD tag, the urlBase parameter does not have any effect.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

The full URL of the document referenced by the internal links from the HTML string.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the binary representation of the PDF document.

member.summary: Converts the specified URL into a PDF document and saves the rendered PDF document into the specified disk file.
member.param: The URL of the web page to be converted to PDF. The URL can be also the full path of a HTML file from the local file system.
The full path of the file where to save the rendered PDF document.

The full path of the file where to save the rendered PDF document

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.SavePdfFromHtmlStringToFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string to PDF and saves the rendered PDF document into the specified disk file. This method does not use any URL base and therefore the images or CSS files referenced by relative URLs in the HTML string cannot be resolved by the converter to a full URL. Also, because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the links with anchors, all the links with anchors are considered to be internal links. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the SavePdfFromHtmlStringToFile method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
The full path of the file where to save the rendered PDF document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.SavePdfFromHtmlStringToFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified HTML string to PDF and saves the rendered PDF document into the specified disk file. The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string. Because this method does not specify the full URL of the document referenced by the internal links, the urlBase will be used by default. To make sure the the external resources referenced by relative URLs and the internal links with anchors are correctly resolved by the converter, the SavePdfFromHtmlStringToFile method with the urlBase and internalLinksDocUrl additional parameters can be used.
member.param: The HTML string to be converted to PDF.
The full path of the file where to save the rendered PDF document.
The urlBase parameter allows the converter to determine the full URLs from relative URLs for images and CSS files appearing in the HTML string.

member.name: E:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.BeforeCreateNextPageEvent
member.summary: This event is raised when the next page is about to be created to continue rendering. The element rendering can be cancelled from the event handler of this event.

member.name: E:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.BeforeRenderNextPageEvent
member.summary: This is event is raised before rendering the content on a page, including the intial page. The element rendering can be cancelled from the event handler of this event.

member.name: E:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PostConvertActionEvent
member.summary: A event raised by converter before saving the document. The argument of this event offers access to the PDF document created by the converter. The PDF document can be further customized by adding new pages, texts, images, other HTML documents, bookmarks, links, digital signatures, templates and watermarks.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the HTML document in pixels. The default width is 1024 pixels and this value can be changed by setting this property or by specifying the htmlDocWidthPx parameter in the constructor. If this property is set to 0 or a to negative value, the width of the HTML document will be automatically calculated. Because all the dimensions in the PDF document are measured in points (1 point is 1/72 inch), it might be necessary to transform pixels to points and points to pixels using the UnitsConverter class in order to better control the HTML to PDF conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the HTML document in pixels. The HTML documentwill be truncated if its height exceeds the specified value of this property. If this parameter is set to 0 or a negative value, the whole HTML document will be converted to PDF. Because all the dimensions in the PDF document are measured in points (1 point is 1/72 inch), it might be necessary to transform pixels to points and points to pixels using the UnitsConverter class in order to better control the HTML to PDF conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key string received from the vendor. If this property is null the converter will automatically enter in evaluation mode and a demo watermark will be displayed on the generated PDF document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfDocumentOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the conversion process and the generated PDF document properties. This property can be used to control the PDF document margins, PDF compression level, JPEG compression level, the PDF page size and orientation, the PDF document headers and footers, conversion of the URLs to links in PDF, conversion of the HTML links with anchors to internal PDF links, true type fonts embedding, fit width and stretch to fit, conversion to a single PDF page, append or prepend external PDF documents.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object to controlling the generated PDF document information like the document title, author, subject or creation date.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object to controlling the generated PDF document security settings like user and owner password, restrict printing or editing of the generated PDF document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfHeaderOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object to control the generated PDF document header options. The header is displayed in the generated PDF document if the PdfDocumentOptions.ShowHeader property is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfFooterOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object to control the generated PDF document footer options. The footer is displayed in the generated PDF document if the PdfDocumentOptions.ShowFooter property is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation for the rendered PDF document. In order to enable creation of bookmarks you have to set the TagNames property of PdfBookmarkOptions with the names of the HTML tags you want to bookmark.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the retrieval of HTML elements position in the generated PDF. In order to retrieve the position in PDF for a list of HTML elements, the HtmlElementIds and HtmlTagNames properties of HtmlElementsMappingOptions must be set with an array of strings containing the HTML IDs and tag names of the HTML elements. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the HtmlElementsMappingResult object.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.HtmlExcludedRegionsOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the exclusion of HTML elements from rendering to PDF. In order to exclude from PDF for a list of HTML elements, the HtmlElementIds and HtmlTagNames properties of HtmlExcludedRegionsOptions must be set with an array of strings containing the HTML IDs or tag names of the HTML elements excluded from conversion to PDF.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling how the generated PDF is displayed by the PDF viewer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ConversionSummary
member.summary: Offers summary information about the conversion process. After a successfull conversion this property is initialized with an instance of the ConversionSummary class. If the conversion failed this property returns a null value.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.HtmlDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords, and description of the converted HTML document. This information can be used for example in the to set the corresponding fields of the PdfDocumentInfo property of a Document object obtained after conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.AvoidTextBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the text between PDF pages. By default this property is true. This property has effect only when generating a PDF with selectable text (PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf is true).

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.RightToLeftEnabled
member.summary: This property is obsolete. Setting this property is not necessary anymore when converting pages in right-to-left languages like Hebrew or Arabic.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.BatchConversion
member.summary: This property is obsolete.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ScriptsEnabled
member.summary: Enable scripts (JavaScript) when converting HTML to a PDF with selectable text. By default this property is false. This property has effect only when generating a PDF with selectable text (PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf is true).

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ScriptsEnabledInImage
member.summary: Enable scripts (JavaScript) when converting HTML to a PDF with embedded image. By default this property is true. This property has effect only when generating a PDF with embedded image. (PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf is false).

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ActiveXEnabled
member.summary: Enable ActiveX (like Flash player) when converting HTML to a PDF with selectable text. By default this property is false. This property has effect only when generating a PDF with selectable text (PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf is true).

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ActiveXEnabledInImage
member.summary: Enable ActiveX (like Flash player ) when converting HTML to a PDF with embedded image. By default this property is true. This property has effect only when generating a PDF with embedded image. (PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf is false).

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.BehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Enable behaviors when rendering HTML to PDF. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.AddPadding
member.summary: Add a padding at the end of the generated PDF document. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.BinaryBehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Enable binary behaviors when rendering HTML to PDF. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.InternetSecurityZone
member.summary: Specifies the internet security zone settings used by the HTML converter to convert web sites. LocalMachine security zone offers most of the rights during conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ExternalSampling
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.SamplingEnabled
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.TruncateOutOfBoundsText
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.OptimizePdfPageBreaks
member.summary: A flag indicating if the converter uses an optimized page breaks algorithm to improve document scrolling inside a PDF Viewer. The optimized algorithm can introduce a small additional processing time when the PDF document is generated. The default value is true and the optimized page breaks algorithm is used by default.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.OptimizeMemoryUsage
member.summary: When this property is true the library will try to release the unused memory as soon as possible. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.SamplingModeAuto
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.SampleHtmlString
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.AdjustBorderSize
member.summary: A small value to subtract from the width and hight of the colored background to make the thin lines of 1 pixel around this background more visible when zooming out in the Adobe Reader PDF Viewer. The default value is 0.5 pixels.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.AdjustThinLinesWidth
member.summary: A small increment value for the 1 pixel thin lines width to make them more visible when zooming out in the Adobe Reader PDF Viewer. The default value is 0 pixels.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.DrawBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML page background is rendered in PDF. Default value is true. Setting this property to false can make visible the existing PDF content behind this element.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.DrawBackColors
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the background color of the HTML elements is rendered in PDF. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.BkgTransparency
member.summary: Modify background transparency. 0 means transparent, 100 means opaque.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ImgTransparency
member.summary: Modify images transparency. 0 means transparent, 100 means opaque.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.AlphaBlendEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables alpha blending for transparent images. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.MaskBltEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables masking for transparent images. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.TransparencyEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the transparency is enabled in the generated PDF document. Default value is true. This property can be set to false to eliminate the additional flattening time when the document is sent to the printer from Adobe Reader viewer.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.UseCrossRefStreams
member.summary: When this property is true, the generated PDF will store the PDF cross-reference table and PDF trailer in compressed cross-reference streams and therefore the generated PDF document will be smaller in size. Set this false for compatibility with third party tools unable to understand the cross-reference streams. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be loaded. A delay is necessary for example to allow a Flash movie to start before starting conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60. You can increase this timeout is you have a very slow network or when you convert a very big file.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the HTTP headers sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. The HTTP headers string can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.SerializeLoadHtml
member.summary: This static flag indicates if the download and execution of the HTML code is serialized when the converter is called simultaneously from multiple threads of an application. This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed in the current process. Default value is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.LoadHtmlConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: This static parameter gives the maximum number of threads in the current process that can download and execute HTML documents simultaneously. This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed in the current process. When this parameter is 0 or negative and SerializeLoadHtml is false the concurrency level is the maximum value.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfConverterConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: This static parameter gives the maximum number of threads in the current .NET application domain that can convert HTML to PDF simultaneously. This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed in the current application domain. When this property is set with a negative value or zero the concurrency level is maximum. The default value is 8.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.LayoutHtmlTimeoutSec
member.summary: This static parameter gives the maximum time in seconds necessary to layout a HTML document. The default value is 10 minutes.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.PdfStandardSubset
member.summary: Defines the PDF subset used by the generated PDF. The default value is Full. This property can be used to instruct the converter to generate PDF/A, PDF/X or PDF/SiqQ compliant documents.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfConverter.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the color space of the generated PDF document. The possible values are RGB, CMYK or Gray Scale. The default color space is RGB.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage
member.summary: Represents a PDF document page

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.AddElement(ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PageElement)
member.summary: Add the specified element to this page.
member.param: The element to be added to this page
member.returns: The result of adding the element to this page

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.Orientation
member.summary: The PDF page orientation

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.RotationAngle
member.summary: The PDF page rotation

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.CustomHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Represents the custom header template for the page. It will replace the document header template on this page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.CustomFooterTemplate
member.summary: Represents the custom footer template for the page. It will replace the document footer template on this page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.ShowHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Show header on this page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.ShowFooterTemplate
member.summary: Show footer on this page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.Margins
member.summary: Gets the page margins

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.PageSize
member.summary: Gets the PDF page size in points.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.Document
member.summary: The parent document of this page

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.PdfPage.PageIndex
member.summary: The page index in pages collection

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement
member.summary: This class encapsulates a HTML to PDF converter. The HTML to PDF conversion is performed when the element is added to a PDF page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.DEFAULT_HTML_VIEWER_WIDTH_PX
member.summary: The default virtual browser width in pixels

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AUTO_HTML_VIEWER_HEIGHT_PX
member.summary: The default virtual browser height in pixels is set to autodetect the HTML content height.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AVAILABLE_PDF_WIDTH_POINTS
member.summary: The default width in PDF of the element is set to available width in PDF page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AUTO_PDF_HEIGHT_POINTS
member.summary: The default width in PDF of the element is set to available width in PDF page.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.paginate
member.summary: When true the text can be paginated

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element that will be rendered at the (0,0) location in PDF page. The width of element in PDF page is the available width in PDF page and the height is auto determined.
member.param: The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. This parameter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element at the specified x and y coordinates with the specified width and height.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or automatic page breaks.
The HTML string convert to PDF.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HTML string to PDF converter element at the specified x and y coordinates with the specified width. The height in PDF is auto determined. The virtual browser width in pixels is specified by the htmlViewerWidth parameter.
member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page
The HTML string convert to PDF.

The full URL of the page from where this string was taken used to resolve the images and CSS files referenced by a relative URL in the HTML string. This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. This parameter has effect only if the specified HTML string contains a HEAD element because a will be inserted automatically by the converter.

The virtual browser width in pixels. The default value is 1024 pixels. The effect of this parameter is similar with viewing the HTML page in a browser window with the specified width. When this parameter is less or equal 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page width from the body element width.

member.param: The x position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The y position in points where the rendered content will be placed
The destination width in points for the rendered content. If the specified with is less or equal 0, the destination width will be given by the available width in page

The destination height in points for the rendered content. If the specified height is less or equal 0, the destination height will be auto determined so all the content can be rendered. Please note that the specified height is the effective height that will be rendered in the PDF document and does not include for example the empty spaces introduced by custom or automatic page breaks.

This parameter is optional and the default value is NULL. When this parameter is NULL no base URL will be used. When this parameter is less or equal 0, the converter will try to auto-determine the HTML page width from the body element width.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlViewerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer width in pixels

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlViewerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML viewer height in pixels. If the viewer width was not set, this property has no effect

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AvoidTextBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the text between PDF pages

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AvoidImageBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the images between PDF pages

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When false the HTML content will be rendered at the real size. By default this property is true and the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the HTML content will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect only when FitWidth property is true. When FitWidth is true and this property is true the HTML content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.LiveUrlsEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the HTML links in PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to convert the internal HTML links to internal PDF links. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AdjustBorderSize
member.summary: A small value to subtract from the width and hight of the colored background to make the thin lines of 1 pixel around this background more visible when zooming out in the Adobe Reader PDF Viewer. The default value is 0.5 pixels.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AdjustThinLinesWidth
member.summary: A small increment value for the 1 pixel thin lines width to make them more visible when zooming out in the Adobe Reader PDF Viewer. The default value is 0 pixels.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.DrawBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the HTML page background is rendered in PDF. Default value is true. Setting this property to false can make visible the existing PDF content behind this element.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.DrawBackColors
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the background color of the HTML elements is rendered in PDF. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.BkgTransparency
member.summary: Modify background transparency. 0 means transparent, 100 means opaque.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ImgTransparency
member.summary: Modify images transparency. 0 means transparent, 100 means opaque.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AlphaBlendEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables alpha blending for transparent images. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.MaskBltEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables masking for transparent images. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.RightToLeftEnabled
member.summary: This property is obsolete. Setting this property is not necessary anymore when converting pages in right-to-left languages like Hebrew or Arabic.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.BatchConversion
member.summary: This property is obsolete.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ScriptsEnabled
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering HTML to selectable PDF. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ScriptsEnabledInImage
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ActiveXEnabled
member.summary: Enable ActiveX when rendering HTML to selectable PDF. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ActiveXEnabledInImage
member.summary: Enable ActiveX when rendering HTML to image. Default is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.BehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Enable behaviors when rendering HTML to image. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AddPadding
member.summary: Add padding at the end of the conversion result. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.BinaryBehaviorsEnabled
member.summary: Internal use. Default is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.InternetSecurityZone
member.summary: Specifies the internet security zone settings used by the HTML converter to convert web sites.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ExternalSampling
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.SamplingEnabled
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.SamplingModeAuto
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.SampleHtmlString
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.TruncateOutOfBoundsText
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.OptimizePdfPageBreaks
member.summary: A flag indicating if the converter uses an optimized page breaks algorithm to improve document scrolling inside a PDF Viewer. The optimized algorithm can introduce a small additional processing time when the PDF document is generated. The default value is true and the optimized page breaks algorithm is used by default.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.OptimizeMemoryUsage
member.summary: When this property is true the library will try to release the unused memory as soon as possible. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.Paginate
member.summary: When true the element can be paginated

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.EmbedFonts
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to embed all the true type fonts into the PDF document. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ConversionDelay
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be loaded. A delay is necessary for example to allow a Flash movie to start before starting conversion.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.NavigationTimeout
member.summary: The navigation timeout in seconds. Default value is 60.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the HTTP headers sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is requested from a URL. The HTTP headers string can be used to define cookies, authentication options, URL referer or any other HTTP header to be sent to the web browser.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: The AuthenticationOptions can be set with an username and a password in order to authenticate to the web server before accessing the URL to be converted. They can be used for example to resolve the IIS Integrated Windows Authentication or other types of IIS authentication. They cannot be used to resolve ASP.NET Forms Authentication or a custom authentication method defined at application level.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ShowHeaderOnOddPages
member.summary: Show or not the document header on odd pages generated by this element. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages. The ShowHeaderTemplate property of the page to which this element is added has priority over ShowHeaderOnOddPages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ShowHeaderOnEvenPages
member.summary: Show or not the document header on even pages generated by this element. By default the header is displayed both on odd and even pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ShowFooterOnOddPages
member.summary: Show or not the document footer on odd pages generated by this element. By default the footer is displayed both on odd and even pages. The ShowFooterTemplate property of the page to which this element is added has priority over ShowFooterOnOddPages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.ShowFooterOnEvenPages
member.summary: Show or not the document footer on even pages generated by this element. By default the footer is displayed both on odd and even pages.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.PdfBookmarkOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the bookmarks creation for the rendered PDF document. In order to enable creation of bookmarks you have to set the TagNames property of PdfBookmarkOptions with the names of the HTML tags you want to bookmark.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the retrieval of HTML elements position in the generated PDF. In order to retrieve the position in PDF for a list of HTML elements, the HtmlElementIds property of HtmlElementsMappingOptions must be set with an array of strings containing the HTML IDs of the HTML elements. The positions of the HTML elements in the generated PDF document will be returned in the HtmlElementsMappingResult object after the element was added to the page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlExcludedRegionsOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the exclusion of HTML elements from rendering to PDF. In order to exclude from PDF for a list of HTML elements, the HtmlElementIds and HtmlTagNames properties of HtmlExcludedRegionsOptions must be set with an array of strings containing the HTML IDs or tag names of the HTML elements excluded from conversion to PDF.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.RenderedPagesRectangles
member.summary: The bounds of the rendered rectangle on each PDF page. This property is assigned after the element has been added to a PDF page.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.HtmlToPdfElement.HtmlDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords, and description of the converted HTML document.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode
member.summary: The view mode when an explicit destination is displayed in the viewer.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode.XYZ
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode.Fit
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode.FitH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode.FitV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode.FitB
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.PdfDocument.DestinationViewMode.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlExcludedRegionsOptions
member.summary: Defines the necessary API to define a set of HTML regions to be excluded from conversion to PDF. The HTML regions to be excluded are defined as HTML elements specified by their unique HTML ID or HTML tag name.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlExcludedRegionsOptions.HtmlElementIds
member.summary: This property is used to set an array containing the HTML IDs of the HTML elements that will be excluded from conversion to PDF. The HTML ID of a HTML element is given by its ID or NAME property in the HTML document. The HTML IDs are case insensitive. If there are many HTML elements with the same HTML ID in the HTML document, only the first HTML element with that ID will be selected.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.HtmlExcludedRegionsOptions.HtmlTagNames
member.summary: This property is used to set an array containing the HTML tag names of the HTML elements that will be excluded from conversion to PDF. The HTML tag names are case insensitive.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary
member.summary: Offers summary information about the conversion process. After a successfull conversion the PdfConverter.ConversionSummary property is initialized with an instance of this class.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.RectangleF[])
member.summary: Creates a ConversionSummary object

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.PdfPageCount
member.summary: The number of pages in the generated PDF document.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.HtmlContentSizePixels
member.summary: The size of the HTML content in pixels.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.HtmlContentSizePoints
member.summary: The size of the HTML content in points. A point is 1/72 inches. The converter internally transforms the HtmlContentSizePixels in points using the UnitsConverter class methods.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.PdfPageSizePoints
member.summary: The page size in points of the generated PDF document

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.HtmlContentWidthResizeFactor
member.summary: The factor used to resize the HTML content when rendered in the PDF document. When PdfConverter.PdfDocumentOptions.FitWidth is true, the HTML content will be resized to fit the PDF page width if necessary.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.LastPageIndex
member.summary: The index of the page where the rendering of the HTML ended. This information is useful when new elements are added after conversion in PostConvertActionEvent handler.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.LastPageRectangle
member.summary: The bounds of the rectangle rendered on the last page. This information is useful when new elements are added after conversion in PostConvertActionEvent handler.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConversionSummary.RenderedPagesRectangles
member.summary: The bounds of the rendered rectangle on each PDF page. This information becomes available in PostConvertActionEvent handler.
